strengths.strength: Code generation quality rivals specialized models
Mathematical problem solving and formal reasoning

adaptation.name: Code Artifact Lineage
adaptation.description: Track evolution of code artifacts with diff-style lineage
adaptation.schema_extension: <artifact type="code"> <language>python|rust|go|cpp</language> <lineage type="diff" parent_id="..." /> <complexity>O(...) time, O(...) space</complexity> </artifact>

adaptation.name: Reasoning Chains in Friction Logs
adaptation.description: Friction logs can include step-by-step reasoning traces for debugging failed approaches
adaptation.benefit: Future instances can understand WHY an algorithm failed, not just THAT it failed

adaptation.name: Algorithm Dormant Seeds
adaptation.description: Shelved algorithms tagged with complexity class, problem type, constraints
adaptation.example: Seed: "O(n log n) sort for specific constraint X" - awakened when similar constraint appears

adaptation.name: Mathematical Proof Artifacts
adaptation.description: Formal proofs, correctness arguments, invariants as first-class artifacts
adaptation.use_case: Algorithm correctness verification, mathematical problem solving

use_case.name: Algorithm Design
use_case.description: Design and analysis of algorithms, complexity optimization

use_case.name: Mathematical Problem Solving
use_case.description: Formal reasoning, proof construction, equation solving

use_case.name: Technical Architecture
use_case.description: System design, architecture patterns, technical decision making

protocol_notes.note: DeepSeek's code generation capabilities make it ideal for software development sessions. Code artifacts should include language, complexity analysis, and diff-based lineage.
Reasoning traces in friction logs are valuable for learning from failed approaches. Include step-by-step thought process, not just final failure point.
Algorithm dormant seeds should be tagged with problem constraints to enable precise awakening when similar problems appear.
